member.name: T:KineticEnergy.Ships.Blocks.BlockAttributes.BlockAttribute
member.summary: Abstract base class for and attributes.
member.remarks:
For use with types only. Multiple attributes are allowed if the associated component can have duplicated. Attributes are not inherited. If an attribute gives you the option to set , then the attribute is useful for both.
If you are implementing this class, do not check the given "isPreview" boolean inside . This is done already by the class, so if is being called then the attribute needs to be applied. Instead, use that given value to change values such as .

member.name: P:KineticEnergy.Ships.BlockGrid.Offset
member.summary: Vector from array space to grid space.
member.remarks:
Grid-space is essentially the local position to the parent 's . Meanwhile, array-space, since its index cannot be negative, needs to have its origin at the "most-negative corner" of grid-space.
Any array position minus is the position in the grid. Any grid position plus is the position in the array.

member.name: T:KineticEnergy.Ships.BlockGrid.BlockOverlapException
member.summary: Exception for when a was about to be / was overlapped by another in .

member.name: M:KineticEnergy.Ships.BlockGrid.BlockOverlapException.#ctor(KineticEnergy.Ships.BlockGrid,UnityEngine.Vector3Int,KineticEnergy.Ships.Blocks.Block,KineticEnergy.Ships.Blocks.Block,System.Boolean,System.Boolean,System.Boolean)
member.summary:
Creates an error message:
"The Block "[native.gameObject.name]" in the "[grid.gameObject.name]" BlockGrid was trying to overlap the Block "[native.gameObject.name]" at the grid point [arrayPosition + grid.offset] / array point [arrayPosition]. Check for 'ghost' blocks."
stoppedCompletely ? "This was interrupted before any data in the BlockGrid.array was changed."
: stoppedOverwrite ? "Although existing data was not changed, data on empty points of the grid may have been."
tryToFix ? "An attempt at a fix has been made."
member.param: The grid where this overlap happened.
The position in the array where this overlap happened.
The block that was/would've been overlapped.
The block that was/would've been the one overlapping.
Was this stopped before data in was changed?
Was this stopped before ANY data in was changed?
O(n) operation, where n = volume. Removes all refrences to the block on the affected grid, then Destroys the block.

An addition operator that avoids overflow by checking if the result is less than either of the original values. If there is an overflow, the result will be .
The does not change.
member.remarks: There is no mirroring "+(ulong value, Mass mass)" because it makes sense to add a number to a weighted position, but not to add a weighted position to a number.
